title: 10 People Share What Got Them Through Their Vaccine Side Effects
author: JR Thorpe
description: 10 people on how they dealt with their COVID vaccine side effects.
cleaned_text: Health #4: Plan not to do much. With appointments for a COVID vaccine becoming the hottest tickets of 2021, getting the shot can feel like a lottery win in your arm. Until you start getting fevers, chills, and waves of crushing fatigue, of course. Experts say [side effects of the COVID vaccines are to be expected](https://www.bustle.com/wellness/covid-19-vaccines-side-effects), and aren't anything to worry about; they're signs that your immune system is kicking into gear, and [learning how to fight COVID](https://www.bustle.com/wellness/how-long-after-covid-vaccine-immunity-full-protection-doctors). But it can still be an exhausting two to three days. That's why people are trading tips on [how to deal with their COVID vaccine side effects](https://www.bustle.com/wellness/how-to-treat-fatigue-covid-vaccine-side-effect-doctors) — like, the ones that actually helped them. If you manage to escape side effects entirely, that [doesn't mean your shot isn't working.](https://www.bustle.com/wellness/covid-19-vaccine-side-effects-working-good-sign-doctors) None of the COVID vaccines currently being used in the U.S. [cause universal adverse effects](https://www.fda.gov/emergency-preparedness-and-response/coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19/covid-19-vaccines), according to the trial data published by the Food & Drug Administration (FDA), meaning that they don't cause side effects in everybody. Nobody knows why some people get side effects and others sail through; it may be something to do with immune systems, or just the luck of the draw. If you've had COVID before, you may be [more vulnerable to aches and pains after a Pfizer vaccination,](https://www.bustle.com/wellness/get-covid-19-vaccine-after-being-sick-doctors) according to the [ ZOE COVID Symptom Study,](https://covid.joinzoe.com/) but that's not confirmed by wider studies yet. If you're wondering how to get through those slightly difficult 24 to 48 hours post shot, here are 10 women and non-binary people sharing their best tips.
